Item ID22975

A brimstone ring is a ring created by combining three untradeable components — the hydra's eye, fang and heart. Players cannot receive a duplicate of these until obtaining the others. It has no requirements to equip and provides the combined offensive and defensive stats of the un-imbued archers, berserker, warrior, seers, treasonous, and Tyrannical rings, along with a Passive effect that improves its effectiveness to rival the Seers ring (i) for best-in-slot when using Magic.

Brimstone rings cannot be imbued.

 Attack bonuses
+4+4+4+6+4

Passive effect[edit | edit source]

The ring has a passive effect when worn. Each time the player attacks using a spell or magical attack, even from a powered staff, there is a 25% chance that the target's defensive roll will be reduced by 10% for that single attack only. [1]

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 January 2019
(update)

A notification regarding the Brimstone ring’s effect in PvP has been corrected.

13 January 2019
 Hotfix

On release, the ring had a chance to reduce the opponent's Magic level instead of ignoring its magic defence, which could be stacked to render NPCs' magical attacks ineffective. This was fixed soon after discovery, approximately 3 days after the item's release. [2]

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The brimstone ring's design comes from the common depiction of the Ouroboros symbol of a serpent or dragon eating its own tail.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 27 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "It'd apply to the creature's defence roll whenever you're doing a magical attack against it. Including [powered staves]."
  2. ↑ Mod Maz. PSA: Brimstone Ring's special effect stacks and reduces it's target's magic level, not magic defense directly (Reddit). 13 January 2019. “This has been hotfixed. Thanks for letting us know.”*

[[File:Brimstone ring detail.png|left|130px]]
A '''brimstone ring''' is a [[ring]] created by combining three untradeable components — the [[hydra's eye]], [[Hydra's fang|fang]] and [[Hydra's heart|heart]]. Players cannot receive a duplicate of these until obtaining the others. It has no requirements to equip and provides the combined offensive and defensive stats of the un-imbued [[Archers ring|archers]], [[Berserker ring|berserker]], [[Warrior ring|warrior]], [[Seers ring|seers]], [[Treasonous ring|treasonous]], and [[Tyrannical ring]]s, along with a [[Passive effect]] that improves its effectiveness to rival the [[Seers ring (i)]] for best-in-slot when using Magic.

Brimstone rings '''cannot''' be imbued.

==Passive effect==
The ring has a passive effect when worn. Each time the player attacks using a [[spell]] or magical attack, even from a [[powered staff]], there is a 25% chance that the target's [[Magic#Magic accuracy|defensive roll]] will be reduced by 10% for that single attack only. {{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1083672005331861504|date=11 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/CE5PW|archivedate=27 May 2020|quote=It'd apply to the creature's defence roll whenever you're doing a magical attack against it. Including [powered staves].}}
